research_field.en: Theoretical studies related to particle-, nuclear-, cosmic ray and astro-physics

department.en: Graduate School, Division of Science and Engineering

department.ja: 応用物理学・工学基礎研究科

paper_title.en: PIXE Analysis of Trace Elements in Human Hair of Patients with Liver Disorders

paper_title.ja: PIXE Analysis of Trace Elements in Human Hair of Patients with Liver Disorders

paper_title.en: Design of heavy-ion APF-IH type linac for atomic physics and medical use

description.en: We have studied a compact heavy-ion linac for atomic physics and medical use. The design of the linac was based on using alternating-phase-focus (APF) and interdigital-H (111) structures which give sufficient electric power efficiency. Thereby. it will be possible to design a small and high efficiency linac, The APF-IH linac was designed to accelerate ions from C2+ to U40+, from 30 to 300 keV/u and an operating frequency of 100 MHz, We made a half-scale cold model of this linac using orbit calculation and measured its RF characteristics. Then, re designed a APF-IH type linac using the results of the measurement, (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights, reserved.

publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS

paper_title.en: Beam acceleration test of the Ridgetron electron accelerator

description.en: A cw electron accelerator system with a ridged cavity resonator, the Ridgetron. has been developed for industrial irradiation. It is intended to accelerate an electron beam up to 10 MeV and extract a beam power of 25 kW. As the first step of investigation, a 2.5 MeV prototype system was constructed. It consists of a cylindrical ridged cavity. four bending magnets and an electron gun. The acceleration test was performed after preliminary commissioning and the electron beam of 5.3 kW was extracted in continuous operation mode. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS

paper_title.en: Study of a four hole ECR ion source for a HIF injector

description.en: We have designed an ECR ion source which extracts four equal beams from one chamber as a study of an ion source for an accelerator that has several RFQ channels in one accelerating cavity for a heavy ion, HIF accelerator. Solenoid coils for the mirror magnetic field were designed using the magnetic field calculation program OPERA. Extraction electrodes were designed by using particle orbital calculation program FUGUN. Based on the above, we designed and manufactured four hole ECR ion source. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V, All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS

paper_title.en: Carbon beam acceleration using a simple injection method into an RFQ

description.en: For medium-heavy ions, a new injection method into a RFQ linac is proposed. Laser plasma is created by an intense Pulsed laser system and directly injected into the RFQ without focusing de-ices. This method may eliminate complex difficulties due to space-charge effects in the low-energy transport system. Using the TITech RFQ, a verification test has been performed. From the laser ablated carbon plasma, C4+ and C3+ beams were captured successfully and were accelerated to the designed energy of the RFQ. The observed total current of carbon beam reached 8 mA, which exceeded the designed current of the RFQ. This method can be easily applied to existing RFQs which are used in medical and industrial accelerator systems. (C) 2002 Published by Elsevier Science B.V.

publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS

paper_title.en: Pulsing system of C-60 beam for the TOF method

description.en: In order to analyze the physical properties of fullerene C-60. which has an especially stable spherical shell structure as a cluster. the energy loss is measured when the fullerene C-60 in the energy region of several 100 eV/amu passes a carbon thin foil using the TOF method. The C-60 direct current beam extracted from an electron impact type ion source needs to be converted to a Pulsed beam. A chopping method as adopted for the pulsing of this direct current beam. and a high frequency chopper was manufactured. In this ay the C-60 direct current beam was changed into it Pulsed beam of frequency 50 mus. and about 2.4 mus half width. After accelerating to 100 kV. the beam as passed through carbon foils of I and 5 mug/cm(2). and energy loss measurements were performed. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS

paper_title.en: A study of a test APF-IH type linac as an injector for cancer therapy

description.en: We are studying a heavy-ion interdigital H (IH) type linear accelerator as an injector for a cancer therapy synchrotron. The compact IH linac accelerates C4- ions from 65 keV/u up to 6 MeV/u with an alternating phase focus (APF) structure. The linac cavity is 3.1 m in length and operates at a frequency of 100 MHz. A test APF-IH linac was designed to accelerate C4- ions from 40 keV/u to 2 MeV/u with an operating frequency of 100 MHz, From particle orbit calculations. using an energy width of +/-0.2%, this linac can accept a transverse emittance of 100 pi mm mrad, a longitudinal phase of 35degrees and a beam intensity of several 100 muA. The test cavity has 1.4 m in length and 56 cm in diameter. We made a basic. half-scale model cavity of this linac and plan to measure its RF characteristics. Using the results of these measurements, a final design of this linac will be determined. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS

paper_title.en: A direct plasma injection system into an RFQ for clean and safe ion implantation

description.en: A new injection system. direct plasma injection system. was tested and its principle was proved successfully. We found that one of advantages of this injection system was efficient consumption of source materials. Large portions of induced ions can be injected into a first stage accelerator. This feature is quite useful for ion implantation applications. because toxic exhaust gas can be eliminated. In order to utilize this system for industrial application. the feasibility of a boron injection scheme using a Nd:YAG laser system was investigated, (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS

paper_title.en: Acceleration test of APF-IH type implanter

description.en: We have designed and manufactured a new compact IH-linac with alternating-phase-focus (APF) system which focuses beams by combination of alternating focus-defocus sections. The APF structure is suitable for shortening the cell length, and the diameter of the acceleration cavity can be reduced by high frequency operation. This linac can accelerate particles up to 85 from 10 keV/u for a charge to mass ratio 1/16. with an operating frequency of 65 MHz. We have constructed an acceleration system for He and tested it using the APF-IH ion implanter. Two problems occurred. Firstly, multi-pactoring electric discharges occurred. Secondly. the orbital calculation program was in error. so we performed more orbital calculations and manufactured a new vacuum exhaust system. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS

publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS

paper_title.en: Development of an ECR ion source for carbon therapy

description.en: A compact electron cyclotron resonance ion source has been developed for heavy-ion medical facilities. The beam intensity and stability were considerably improved by recent modifications on three points (length of sextupole, cooling system for the extraction electrode, and position of the Einzel lens). Initial results of C4+ beam tests show that an intensity of 180 emuA can be routinely obtained with simple tuning. The best record was 220 emuA for C4+, which meets the medical requirements. Throughout these tests, CH4 gas was used with 0.1 cc/min and the extraction voltage was fixed at 25 kV. Results on beam emittance and long-term stability are also briefly discussed. (C) 2002 American Institute of Physics.

paper_title.en: Design and construction of four-hole ECR ion source

description.en: When a large current is accelerated, many radio frequency quadrupole (RFQ) LINAC are needed, because the acceleration limit of a RFQ LINAC is 20 mA-30 mA. Therefore the same number of ion source are needed. But the limit is not the current limit of ion source. If the RFQ LINAC has many RFQ channels, it can accelerate large currents. We designed an accelerator with four RFQ channels to prove this principle. An ion source which extracts four equal beams from one chamber is needed for this RFQ LINAC. A four-hole ECR ion source was designed and manufactured after calculating the magnetic fields by OPERA, and simulating beam trajectory using the program FUGUN. In this ion source, since four extraction holes are located off axis by about 50 mm, the beam is deflected. We calculated this deviation. (C) 2002 American Institute of Physics.
